author: Staff Reporter
text:
Fishermen from 44 coastal villages from Neerodi to Arogyapuram in Kanyakumari district have decided to boycott the Assembly election if their demands for a separate ministry for the welfare of fishermen and inclusion of fishermen community in Scheduled Tribes list are not met. Fr. Churchill, general secretary, South Asian Fishermen Fraternity, told The Hindu here on Friday that nearly 10 per cent of total voters – 1.5 lakh – will boycott the election. Fishermen lived in large numbers in Killiyoor, Kanyakumari, Colachel and Vilavancode constituencies in Kanyakumari district, he said.

Bifurcating the agriculture ministry and creating a separate ministry for fisheries and fishermen welfare at the Centre is the need of the hour. He said that a progressive legislation, Fishermen and other traditional coastal communities rights (recognition of fishermen rights) Act, on the lines of the Scheduled Tribes and Other Traditional Forest Dwellers (Recognition of Forest Rights Act) 2006 should be enacted by the Union government. Similarly, as per the recommendations of the Mandal Commission, the Union government should bring fishermen community under the Scheduled Tribes list. Fr. Churchil said that the various forums for fishermen had staged a protest in New Delhi on Thursday pressing their legitimate demands.

A petition was submitted to the Collector by SAFF on Thursday, he added.
title: Fishermen to boycott polls: SAFF
